nodes.bodyText: Where it is required? And from where this value comes.

The compiler generates a warning because this class implements Serializable without an identifier.  I would guess that it's autogenerated by Android Studio based on the class structure.
If you're curious: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/Serializable.html

Serial version UID in a class is used to ensure that an object of the class is of the particular version of the class.
Yes, this is autogenerated by Android Studio based on the class structure using the plugin GenerateSerialVersionUID
Is this authority or environment?  Just not sure what this method returns hence the question.  No change to the code though... so not worried about this.

Hi Shane, this is because of the request parameter of type GenericAuthorizationRequest and not due to the environment. I'll mention this in the comment in the next PR.
Thanks
